snippet: When an earthquake in April set off an avalanche that buried the hiking village of Langtang, the impact was equivalent to the detonation of 7.6 kilotons of TNT, a study found.
abstract: Study published in journal Science finds avalanche that destroyed village of Langtang in Nepal in April struck with half force of atomic bomb, or equivalent of detonating 7.6 kilotons of TNT.

byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma contributed reporting from Kathmandu, Nepal.

lead_paragraph: When an earthquake in April set off an avalanche that buried the hiking village of Langtang, the impact was equivalent to the detonation of 7.6 kilotons of TNT, a study found.

headline.main: Nepal Avalanche Carried Half the Force of an Atomic Bomb
headline.print_headline: Avalanche Struck Nepal Half as Hard as Atom Bomb
